page.title: 06Health Service, Haltwhistle
page.content: The health centre in Haltwhistle was opened four years ago and is one of the most up to date in the area. It works on an appointment system and has four resident doctors and three nurses who also make visits to patients in outlying areas. The centre also houses a child welfare clinic and a dental clinic. The War Memorial Hospital was created from a large house at the time of the First World War. Many local people were born in its maternity unit but this had to be closed down when the only maternity nurse in the town had her own baby. Today mothers must travel 15 miles to Hexham to have their babies. The hospital has an outpatients accident department but its main work is in caring for elderly patients who can no longer look after themselves.
